gametext: Once per turn, your non-droid character lost from same site may go to your Used Pile rather than your Lost Pile. Subtracts 2 from X on your Bacta Tank.
lore: Made by Genetech. Unusually independent for a droid. Forced to serve a Moff on Firro, but was liberated by Tiree. Now dedicated to serving the Alliance.
name: 2-1B (Too-Onebee)

gametext: Deploy on your Skywalker of ability > 3. May add 1 to Force drain where present. May target a character or creature for free. Draw two destiny. Target hit, and its forfeit = 0, if total destiny > defense value.
lore: Constructed by Anakin Skywalker. Kept by Obi-Wan Kenobi until given to Luke.
name: Anakin's Lightsaber

gametext: Use 2 Force to deploy on your warrior. Your artillery weapons anywhere on same planet may fire without a warrior present. Also, once during each of your control phases, one of your artillery weapons on same planet may be fired.
lore: Although artillery weapons have a manual firing mechanism, this optional device allows weapons operation from a remote location. Uses coded signals.
name: Artillery Remote

gametext: Deploy on an exterior planet site. Your warrior present may target a vehicle at same or adjacent site using 2 Force. Draw destiny. Target crashes if destiny +2 > armor. Target hit if destiny +1 > maneuver.
lore: Atgar 1.4 FD P-tower anti-vehicle cannon. Adapted to operate with minimal performance loss in the extremes of a cold environment.
name: Atgar Laser Cannon

gametext: If a battle was just initiated at a site, identify your lead T-47 there. For remainder of turn, each other T-47 at same site is power +1, is immune to attrition and cannot be targeted by weapons.
lore: Snowspeeder attack plan devised by Commander Skywalker and Rebel tactician Beryl Chifonage. Single-file formation protects the squadron as the leader draws fire.
name: Attack Pattern Delta

gametext: Use 4 Force to deploy on your side of table. A non-droid character you just lost may be placed here. Holds one 'patient' at a time. During your deploy phase, may use X Force to bring 'patient' to hand, where X = deploy cost of 'patient.'
lore: Medical wonder invented centuries ago by the Vratix insectoid species. Gelatinous red bacta is suspended in a synthetic solution to create a healing bacterial medium.
name: Bacta Tank

gametext: Power +1 at Defensive Perimeter. Your vehicles move for free if moving toward same site as Cal.
lore: An expert \b scout\b0  originally from Kai'Shebbol in the Kathol sector. Served with Bren Derlin for many years. Patrols the outer perimeter of Echo Base.
name: Cal Alder

gametext: Deploys only on Hoth. Adds 3 to power of anything he pilots. When piloting Rogue 1, also adds 2 to maneuver. Immune to attrition < 3. Adds 1 to forfeit of each other Rogue Squadron pilot or gunner at same Hoth site.
lore: Hero of Yavin. Promoted to Commander in his third year of military training with the Alliance. Squadron flight \b leader\b0  at Echo Base during the Battle of Hoth.
name: Commander Luke Skywalker

gametext: Use 2 Force to deploy on your warrior. May 'throw' at same or adjacent site. Draw destiny. All characters, weapons and devices with that destiny number present at that site are lost. (Only your warrior is lost if destiny = 0.) Concussion Grenade also lost.
lore: Mier-Lan V-59 grenade. Blows stuff up.
name: Concussion Grenade

gametext: Adds 1 to weapon destiny draws of anything he is aboard as a passenger (adds 3 if aboard Rogue 1 or with Luke).
lore: Born in an Imperial labor camp on Kalist 6. Joined the Rebellion after his escape. Young student of Commander Skywalker. Experienced crack-shot \b gunner\b0.
name: Dack Ralter

gametext: USED: Cancel Dark Collaboration or Lone Pilot. LOST: If two Imperials each with ability > 2 are in a battle together, use 2 Force to draw two destiny. Subtract that amount from opponent's attrition and total power.
lore: The huge Imperial officers corps, with its high rate of turnover, is ripe with competitiveness and ambition. Advancement comes at the expense of another's career.
name: Dark Dissension

gametext: Power +2 when at same site as Biggs. Adds 2 to power of anything he pilots (3 if a Star Destroyer is at same location). When piloting Rogue 4, also adds 2 to maneuver.
lore: Defected from the Empire with Biggs Darklighter. Aided in mutiny aboard the transport \ul Rand Ecliptic\ul0. Served in the \ul Ecliptic\ul0  Evaders. Luke's wingman at the Battle of Hoth.
name: Derek 'Hobbie' Klivian

gametext: If you have a character with a weapon at same site as any creature, deploy on that creature during any deploy phase. Creature is Disarmed (each time ferocity is calculated, draw destiny, subtract that amount). (Immune to Control.)
lore: Luke's defensive maneuver put him out of arm's way.
name: Disarming Creature

gametext: Use 2 Force to deploy on your T-47. May target a character, creature or vehicle using 1 Force. Draw destiny. Subtract 1 if targeting a character or creature. Add 2 if targeting a vehicle. Target hit if total destiny > defense value.
lore: Sund x2-100 laser cannon. Popular among outlaw organizations because it is both cheap and powerful. Frequently mounted on T-47 airspeeders.
name: Dual Laser Cannon

gametext: Adds 1 to power of each of your droids present, except power droids. * Destiny equals zero, but if drawn as a battle destiny where you have less power than opponent, your total power present is doubled (once per battle).
lore: Very popular droid on inhospitable worlds. Rugged design. Modified top-mounted power sockets. Donated to the Alliance by the Bothan underground.
name: EG-4 (Eegee-Four)

gametext: Deploy on Main Power Generators if you occupy at least three Echo sites. At every system location, your deploy is -1, your Force drains are +2 and your total power is +3 in battles. Effect canceled if opponent occupies five Hoth sites. (Immune to Alter.)
lore: Following the Battle of Yavin, the Alliance garnered the support of systems ready to oppose the Empire. Echo Base provides a command center for focusing that support.
name: Echo Base Operations

characteristics: \b Echo Base trooper\b0, \b Rebel trooper\b0, \b trooper\b0
gametext: Deploys only on Hoth. Power -1 when not at a Hoth site.
lore: The personnel assigned to protect Echo Base are veteran warriors. Troopers such as Jess Allashane are trained to counter Imperial tactics in cold environment.
name: Echo Base Trooper

characteristics: \b Echo Base trooper\b0, \b Rebel trooper\b0, \b trooper\b0
gametext: Deploys only on Hoth. Echo Base Troopers deploy -1 to same site. Your troopers may move to same Hoth site as a 'react.'
lore: Like many Rebel specialists, Trey Callum defected from the Imperial officer corps. Trooper officers are masters at stretching the meager resources of the Rebellion.
name: Echo Base Trooper Officer

gametext: Deploy on your trooper. May use any number of weapons and devices. Trooper is immune to attrition < 3 when at a planet site.
lore: Rebels carry a variety of equipment to be fully prepared for enemies and the elements. Weather-resistant backpacks keep gear protected and operational.
name: Echo Trooper Backpack

gametext: Deploy on your war room. Once during each of your move phases, your Planet Defender Ion Cannon at same planet may fire. Also, each of your medium transports at same planet is hyperspeed +2, is immune to attrition < 3 and may move for free.
lore: "Give the evacuation code signal ... and get to your transports!"
name: Evacuation Control

gametext: Once per turn, your 'hit' non-droid character at same or adjacent site may go to your Used Pile rather than your Lost Pile. \b Cumulatively\b0  subtracts 2 from X on your Bacta Tank.
lore: Model nicknamed "Fixit" by Rebels at Echo Base. Though obsolete in advanced hospitals, FX-7 droids still operate at many Rebel outposts as assistant surgeons.
name: FX-7 (Effex-Seven)

gametext: If opponent just initiated a battle at an exterior site with more than double your total power, use 1 Force to cancel the battle and move all your characters there to an adjacent site (for free) where the opponent has no presence.
lore: "K-one zero ... all troops disengage."
name: Fall Back!

gametext: Deploy on Hoth system. At the end of each player's turn, for every character that player has present at a marker site under "nighttime conditions," that player must lose 1 Force (2 if character is missing).
lore: "Then I'll see you in hell!"
name: Frostbite

gametext: Adds 1 to power of each of your Rebels present at same Hoth site. May use 1 Force to cancel Death Squadron. While at an Echo site, opponent must occupy an additional Hoth site to cancel Echo Base Operations.
lore: One of the original founders of the Rebel Alliance. Former civilian strategist with the House of Organa. Somber \b leader\b0  of Echo Base.
name: General Carlist Rieekan

gametext: Deploy on any exterior planet site. Your warrior present may target a creature, character or vehicle at same or adjacent site using 2 Force. Draw destiny. Add 2 if targeting a creature or character. Target hit if destiny > defense value.
lore: Modified Golan Arms DF.9 anti-infantry battery. Proton-shielded control cylinder capped by one or more rotating turret-mounted laser cannons.
name: Golan Laser Battery

dark_side_text: If you control, for each of your starships here, your total power is +1 in battles at Hoth sites.
gametext: If you control, for each of your starships here, your total power is +1 in battles at Hoth sites.   If you control, for each of your starships here, your total power is +1 in battles at Hoth sites.
light_side_text: If you control, for each of your starships here, your total power is +1 in battles at Hoth sites.
name: Hoth

gametext: Deploy on your Rebel or warrior. While on Hoth, that character is power and forfeit +1 and is immune to Frostbite, Exposure and Ice Storm.
lore: Cold-weather gear worn and carried by Echo Base troops. Enhances their ability to function and survive in Hoth's hostile environment.
name: Hoth Survival Gear

gametext: Your Echo Base Troopers deploy -1 here. Force drain +1 here.   Force drain +1 here.
light_side_text: Your Echo Base Troopers deploy -1 here. Force drain +1 here.
name: Hoth: Defensive Perimeter

dark_side_text: Force drain -1 here. If you initiate a battle here, add one battle destiny.
gametext: If you control, with X leaders here, your total power is +X in battles at Hoth locations.   Force drain -1 here. If you initiate a battle here, add one battle destiny.
light_side_text: If you control, with X leaders here, your total power is +X in battles at Hoth locations.
name: Hoth: Echo Command Center (War Room)

gametext: If you control, once per turn, may use 4 Force to raise a converted Hoth site to the top.
light_side_text: If you control, once per turn, may use 4 Force to raise a converted Hoth site to the top.
name: Hoth: Echo Corridor

dark_side_text: Your docking bay transit from here requires 3 Force. Your transit to here requires +4 Force.
gametext: Your docking bay transit from here requires 1 Force.   Your docking bay transit from here requires 3 Force. Your transit to here requires +4 Force.
light_side_text: Your docking bay transit from here requires 1 Force.
name: Hoth: Echo Docking Bay

dark_side_text: If you control with an Imperial present, Force drain +1 here.
gametext: Once per turn, if you deploy a medical droid, it is deploy -2.   If you control with an Imperial present, Force drain +1 here.
light_side_text: Once per turn, if you deploy a medical droid, it is deploy -2.
name: Hoth: Echo Med Lab

dark_side_text: "Hoth Energy Shield Rules" in effect. If "blown away," Light Side loses 8 Force.
gametext: "Hoth Energy Shield Rules" in effect. Your artillery weapons here are powered.   "Hoth Energy Shield Rules" in effect. If "blown away," Light Side loses 8 Force.
light_side_text: "Hoth Energy Shield Rules" in effect. Your artillery weapons here are powered.
name: Hoth: Main Power Generators

dark_side_text: This site does not count when calculating Epic Events.
gametext: This site does not count when calculating Epic Events.   This site does not count when calculating Epic Events.
light_side_text: This site does not count when calculating Epic Events.
name: Hoth: North Ridge

dark_side_text: If you control, Force generation +1 for you here.
gametext: Add 1 to each of your weapon destiny draws here.   If you control, Force generation +1 for you here.
light_side_text: Add 1 to each of your weapon destiny draws here.
name: Hoth: Snow Trench

gametext: Sacrifice (lose) your creature vehicle to protect one character present from Exposure, Ice Storm, Frostbite and Gravel Storm for remainder of turn. (Two characters may be protected if sacrificing a ronto.) OR Double Tzizvvt's power until he moves.
lore: "Hang on, kid. This may smell bad, kid ... but it'll keep you warm ... until I can get the shelter built ..."
name: I Thought They Smelled Bad On The Outside

gametext: Deploy at outermost marker. All characters present at same exterior site are missing. Each turn, during your control phase, storm moves to next marker, reversing direction if at innermost marker. Mobile Effect lost when moved beyond outermost marker.
lore: The intensity of a Hoth ice storm is exacerbated by its speed and erratic movement across the frozen planet.
name: Ice Storm

gametext: Deploy at same exterior site as your mining droid. 'Explodes' if a character deploys or moves (without using a vehicle or starfighter) to or across same site. Draw destiny. Character lost if destiny +2 > defense value. Infantry Mine is also lost.
lore: Typically stolen by Rebel spies and saboteurs from the perimeter of high-security Imperial installations.
name: Infantry Mine

gametext: Use 3 Force to place an opponent's just deployed character, starship, vehicle, weapon, or device in opponent's hand. On opponent's next turn, that card (or one card of same title) may deploy for free.
lore: "Sir, might I suggest that you -- It can wait."
name: It Can Wait

gametext: Adds 2 to power of anything he pilots. When in battle with a Rebel leader, subtracts 1 from opponent's total battle destiny.
lore: Native of Ralltiir. \b Spy\b0  for Ralltiir's underground network after his homeworld was subjugated.
name: Jeroen Webb

gametext: May initiate battle and be battled. K-3PO is power +1 for each of your other droids at same Hoth or Yavin 4 site. Functions as a leader if present with another of your droids.
lore: Old-model protocol droid. Learned military tactics while under the ownership of Commander Narra. In charge of the droid pool at Echo Base.
name: K-3PO (Kay-Threepio)

gametext: Add X to one weapon destiny (before weapon destiny is drawn) when targeting a combat vehicle. USED: X = 1. LOST: X = 3.
lore: AT-ATs are nearly impervious to infantry fire, but occasionally a blaster bolt hits between the plating. It's one shot in a million, but such odds are a familiar to the Rebellion.
name: Lucky Shot

gametext: While on Hoth, opponent may not 'react' to any Echo site, and Derlin may use 1 Force to cancel Breached Defenses. While at Cantina, power +1 and may use 1 Force to cancel Local Trouble.
lore: Hero of Nentan. Supervised construction of Echo Base on Hoth. Head of base security. At the Mos Eisley Cantina, everyone knows his name.
name: Major Bren Derlin

gametext: Deploy on a site. May be moved by two warriors for 1 additional Force. Your warrior present may target up to two characters or creatures at same or adjacent site using 2 Force. Draw two destiny. Target(s) hit if total destiny > total defense value.
lore: Merr-Sonn Mark II repeating blaster. Accepts power cells from a very wide variety of sources, a benefit for Rebels accustomed to scavenging for supplies.
name: Medium Repeating Blaster Cannon

gametext: Deploys and moves like a starfighter. May add 1 pilot, 4 passengers and 1 vehicle. Has ship-docking capability. Permanent pilot provides ability of 1.
lore: Passenger and cargo transport built by Gallofree Yards. Enormous cargo bays can be outfitted to safely accommodate large numbers of troops, munitions or supplies.
name: Medium Transport

gametext: Send one of your missing characters at same site as one of your piloted or driven vehicles to your Used Pile. OR Cancel any attempt by one character to 'hide' from a battle.
lore: "Echo Base, this is Rogue 2. I've found them. Repeat, I've found them."
name: Nice Of You Guys To Drop By

gametext: If you are about to draw power harpoon weapon destiny, add ability of one pilot aboard same vehicle.
lore: "Cable out. Let 'er go!"
name: One More Pass

dark_side_text: Each of your bounty hunter pilots add an additional 1 to power of starships they pilot here.
gametext: If you control, each of opponent's bounty hunters is forfeit -2.   Each of your bounty hunter pilots add an additional 1 to power of starships they pilot here.
light_side_text: If you control, each of opponent's bounty hunters is forfeit -2.
name: Ord Mantell

gametext: Use 1 Force to peek at any one card which is face-down at a location. OR Use 1 Force to peek at opponent's hand. You may move each droid spy and Infantry Mine you find there to opponent's Used Pile. OR Cancel Probe Telemetry.
lore: "It's a good bet the Empire knows we're here."
name: Perimeter Scan

gametext: Deploy on an exterior Rebel Base site. During a battle at related system, may target a capital starship there using 2 Force. Draw destiny. If destiny +3 > armor, all starship weapons aboard target are lost, power = 0 and hyperspeed = 0.
lore: KDY v-150 surface-to-space heavy ion cannon. The most powerful ground-based weapon in the Rebel arsenal. Reserved for strategic installations due to limited supply.
name: Planet Defender Ion Cannon

gametext: Use 2 Force to deploy on your combat or shuttle vehicle. May target an AT-AT or AT-ST for 1 Force. Draw destiny. Target crashes if destiny + your vehicle's maneuver > 8. Your vehicle 'crashes' if destiny = 0.
lore: High-powered harpoon attached to a retractable flexi-steel tow cable and fusion-head disk designed by Beryl Chiffonage as a reserve defense against Imperial AT-ATs.
name: Power Harpoon

gametext: Once during each of your control phases, for each opponent's spy present, opponent must lose 1 Force (2 if spy is a droid or is Undercover, 4 if both).
lore: Designed as a response to the threat of Imperial espionage droids. Joins a droid pool and uncovers spies. Has tattoo reading "Thank The Maker" on left posterior plating.
name: R-3PO (Ar-Threepio)

gametext: Deploy on your R-unit droid. Your characters present may move as a 'react' from a creature attack. Also, adds 3 to search party destiny draws at same and adjacent sites.
lore: Popular R2 astromech accessory manufactured by Industrial Automation. Can monitor radiation levels and detect nearby lifeforms.
name: R2 Sensor Array

gametext: When aboard a capital starship, adds 1 to power and hyperspeed and that starship is immune to attrition < 3.
lore: Programmed to pilot sublight tactical courses. R5 units are in high demand for combat starships. R5-M2 helped plan evacuation routes from Echo Base. Owned by Shawn Valdez.
name: R5-M2 (Arfive-Emmtoo)

gametext: May move as a 'react' (for free) to a battle where you have a Rebel of ability > 2 or a leader.
lore: A Rebel \b scout\b0  such as Vildar Blin is usually assigned to recon missions. Trained in first-response tactics, many come to the Alliance with prior special forces experience.
name: Rebel Scout

gametext: May add 2 pilots or passengers. Immune to attrition < 3 if Luke piloting. May move as a 'react' only to Hoth sites.
lore: Designated Rogue Leader. Led snowspeeder attack during the Battle of Hoth. \b Enclosed\b0. Piloted by Commander Skywalker, with Dack Ralter as tailgunner.
name: Rogue 1

gametext: May add 2 pilots or passengers. Immune to attrition < 3 if Zev piloting. May add 2 to search party destiny draw if all pilots aboard are part of that search party.
lore: \b Enclosed\b0. First snowspeeder to be successfully adapted to Hoth's environment. Piloted by Zev Senesca. Led team in search of Captian Solo and Commander Skywalker.
name: Rogue 2

gametext: May add 2 pilots or passengers. Immune to attrition < 3 if Wedge piloting. May move as a 'react' only to Hoth sites.
lore: \b Enclosed\b0. Piloted by Commander Wedge Antilles. Successful walker tripper. Abandoned during the Rebel evacuation of Echo Base.
name: Rogue 3

gametext: Adds 1 to weapon destiny draws of anything he is aboard as a passenger.
lore: Tailgunners such as Kesin Ommis from Coruscant are posted to aft gunnery stations on vehicles and starships. Highly trained in weapons operations.
name: Rogue Gunner

gametext: Adds 1 to power and maneuver of anything he pilots. Opponent may not 'react' to or from same location.
lore: Corellian pilot. Defected from the Empire shortly after graduation from the Academy. Tech communications officer at Echo Base. Relays orders to nearby Rebel starships.
name: Romas "Lock" Navander

gametext: If Luke and Chewie are in a battle together, you may add two battle destiny. OR If you have a Rebel and an alien in a battle together, you may add 4 to power only.
lore: Wookiees are known to be creatures of great emotion and are very protective of family and friends. Chewbacca has come to treat Luke as a member of his own family.
name: Rug Hug

gametext: Whenever you just initiated a battle at same site as Shawn, your troopers at adjacent sites who have not already battled this turn may immediately move to same site (as a regular move).
lore: Experienced evacuation officer. Charismatic \b leader\b0  of Echo Base troopers. Trained to expedite the evacuation of Rebel installations with maximum efficiency. Poetic \b musician\b0.
name: Shawn Valdez

gametext: May add 1 pilot or passenger. Permanent pilot aboard provides ability of 1. May move as a 'react' to Hoth sites.
lore: Modified Incom T-47 airspeeder. \b Enclosed\b0. Adapted to the cold by installation of repulsor coil heaters. Rebels typically nickname converted speeders after the intended environment.
name: Snowspeeder

gametext: Use 1 Force to deploy on your starfighter, free on \ul Falcon\ul0. May target a character or creature at same site using 1 Force. Draw destiny. Target hit if destiny +1 > defense value.
lore: BlasTech Ax-108 "Ground Buzzer" blaster cannon. Designed to drop from a concealed gun pod on a starship. Targets using proximity motion sensors. Has 360-degree firing arc.
name: Surface Defense Cannon

gametext: Adds 2 to power of anything he pilots. Your starships may move from same exterior site for free. While at Echo Docking Bay, once every turn, may allow one character on Hoth to be immune to The Shield Doors Must Be Closed.
lore: A native of Esseles. Resigned from Esselian defense force after the Imperial Senate was disbanded. Senior deck officer of Echo Base responsible for docking bay operations.
name: Tamizander Rey

gametext: May add 1 'rider' (passenger). Deploy only on Hoth. Ability = 1/4. May move as a 'react' from a battle. May be 'sacrificed' (lost) to make rider immune to Exposure this turn.
lore: First native creature found on Hoth. Roam the icy plans in herds. Ill-tempered and easily spooked. Smell bad on the outside. Trained as steeds for Rebel patrols.
name: Tauntaun

gametext: Use 1 Force to deploy on table. Each opponent's destiny draw, you do the following: (0) Put top used card in hand; (1) lose 1 Force. (2) activate 1 Force; (3) lose this Effect; (4) retrieve 1 Force; (5) deploy a character for free; (6+) nothing.
lore: The bones of a tauntaun represent both death and life: death for the prey, life for the predator. A symbol of the ebb and flow of the Force through all things.
name: Tauntaun Bones

gametext: Adds 2 to power of any creature vehicle he rides. When riding a tauntaun, also draws one battle destiny if not able to otherwise.
lore: Corman Quien is a typical \b scout\b0  at Echo Base. Captured, tamed and trained the native tauntauns.
name: Tauntaun Handler

gametext: Deploy on any system (except Hoth). Target a Medium Transport at a Hoth site. When reached by target: Retrieve X Force, where X = twice the number of passengers. Relocate Utinni Effect to Hoth system. Your total power is +2 in battles at Hoth sites.
lore: "When you've gotten past the energy shield, proceed directly to the rendezvouz point. Understood? Good luck!"
name: The First Transport Is Away!

gametext: Deploys only on Yavin 4 or Hoth. Opponent's aliens and Imperials may not move from same site as Tigran to an Echo or an interior Yavin site.
lore: Senior logistics officer from Onderon. Left Dantooine to serve on Yavin 4 before coming to Hoth. All personnel entering Echo Base must report to him.
name: Tigran Jamiro

gametext: Adds 2 to power of anything she pilots. When at any war room, adds 1 to weapon destiny draws of your Planet Defender Ion Cannon on same planet.
lore: Chief Controller at Echo Command. Responsible for communicating orders to the troops. Personally gives firing orders to Ion Cannon Control.
name: Toryn Farr

gametext: During your control phase, target a vehicle with armor present with your warrior. Draw destiny. If warrior has a Concussion Grenade or a lightsaber, add 3 to destiny draw (7 if both). Vehicle (and grenade) lost if total destiny > armor.
lore: With the Rebels' limited resources and small numbers, desperate strategies are often required.
name: Under Attack

gametext: Deploy at same exterior site as your mining droid. 'Explodes' if starfighter (use 5 as defense value) or non-creature vehicle deploys or moves to or across same site. Draw destiny. Target lost if destiny +2 > defense value. Vehicle Mine is also lost.
lore: Mine controlled by microcircuitry calibrated to ignore infantry and creatures. Explodes only when triggered by metallic vehicles.
name: Vehicle Mine

gametext: While at an exterior planet site or docking bay, once per turn may lose 1 Force to place a 'hit' starship or vehicle at same site, adjacent site, related system or related cloud sector in Used Pile instead of Lost Pile.
lore: Cybot Galactica starship maintenance droid. Repairs over 5,000 different onboard systems. Used by Rebel Alliance salvage teams.
name: WED-1016 'Techie' Droid

gametext: If opponent just moved or deployed an AT-AT to a planet site, deploy up to three exterior sites of that planet from Reserve Deck; reshuffle.
lore: "Echo station, 3TA. We have spotted Imperial walkers." A Rebel tactic is to put as much ground as possible between walkers and Rebel troops, allowing time to prepare a defense.
name: Walker Sighting

gametext: Adds 1 to weapon destiny draws of anything he is aboard as a passenger (adds 3 if aboard Rogue 3 or with Wedge or Jek).
lore: Served for many years as a \b gunner\b0  with friend Jek Porkins in the Tierlon Yellow Aces. Expert marksmanship helped the Alliance earn some of its earliest victories.
name: Wes Janson

gametext: Cancel Scruffy-Looking Nerf Herder or I'd Just As Soon Kiss A Wookiee or Furry Fury or This Is Just Wrong or Death Mark or Mournful Roar or Takeel or Ket Maliss. OR Double Rennek's power for remainder of turn.
lore: "I must've hit pretty close to the mark to get her all riled up like that, huh kid?"
name: Who's Scruffy-Looking?

gametext: Once during each of your control phases, may peek at X cards randomly selected from opponent's hand, where X = number of (Dark Side Force icon) icons at same site. Also, when you are drawing destiny, adds 2 to the destiny of any card with 'scan' in the title.
lore: Rebel \b spy\b0. Served undercover as a sensor specialist aboard the Star Destroyer \ul Avenger\ul0. Assigned to scan for Imperial ships through the meteor activity of the Hoth system.
name: Wyron Serper

gametext: If Vader is on table when opponent has just initiated a battle, target one opponent's leader of ability < 6 involved in that battle. If opponent does not win battle, target is forfeit = 0 and is lost (placed out of play if Ozzel).
lore: "Lord Vader, the fleet has moved out of lightspeed and we're preparing to aah...ukh...uh...uuuuukkk!"
name: You Have Failed Me For The Last Time

gametext: During your control phase, use 1 Force to move any one of your [Hoth] icon characters of ability > 1 to any [Dagobah] icon location where you have presence. If moving to a Dagobah site, this movement is free and you do not need presence.
lore: "There you will learn from Yoda, the Jedi Master who instructed me."
name: You Will Go To The Dagobah System

gametext: Adds 2 to power of anything he pilots. When piloting Rogue 2, also adds 3 to maneuver and may draw one battle destiny if not able to otherwise.
lore: Born on Kestic Station near the Bestine system. Daring pilot who can fly anything. Found Luke and Han in the Hoth wasteland. Piloted Rogue 2 at the Battle of Hoth.
name: Zev Senesca

gametext: If opponent just deployed a planet site, deploy the related system from your Reserve Deck; reshuffle.
lore: Absolute control wielded by the Emperor enables the Imperial forces to dominate planetary systems before the Rebel Alliance can gain a foothold.
name: A Dark Time For The Rebellion

gametext: Use 2 Force to deploy on your AT-AT. May target a starfighter (use 3 as defense value), character, creature or vehicle at same or adjacent site using 2 Force. Draw destiny. Add 1 if targeting a character or creature, 2 if a vehicle. Target hit if total destiny > defense value.
lore: Laser cannons mounted on the head of an Imperial walker provide devastating coordinated firepower. Effective against a wide variety of targets.
name: AT-AT Cannon

gametext: Adds 2 to power of any combat vehicle he pilots (3 if combat vehicle is an AT-AT).
lore: Piloting walkers high above the battlefield, AT-AT drivers are protected by 15 centimeters of reinforced armor. Accordingly, they are regarded with contempt by the infantry.
name: AT-AT Driver

gametext: Adds 2 to the power of anything he pilots. Subtracts 1 from deploy cost of each of your capital starships at same system. Lost if Vader on table and opponent 'reacts' to same location as Ozzel.
lore: \b Leader\b0  of the Emperor's Death Squadron assigned to hunt down and crush the Rebellion. As clumsy as he is stupid. Has just failed Darth Vader for the next-to-last time.
name: Admiral Ozzel

gametext: May add 2 pilots and 8 passengers. Immune to attrition < 4. Landspeed may not be increased. When using AT-AT Cannon to Target The Main Generator, adds 1 to total.
lore: General Veers' AT-AT. \b Enclosed\b0. Equipped with highly sophisticated communications gear. Employs an experimental targeting system.
name: Blizzard 1

gametext: May add 1 pilot and 8 passengers. Immune to attrition < 4. Landspeed may not be increased. Permanent pilot provides ability of 2.
lore: AT-AT commanded by the treacherous General Nevar before he was assassinated. Fortified with an extra layer of armor by the paranoid general. \b Enclosed\b0.
name: Blizzard 2

gametext: May add 1 pilot or passenger. May move as a 'react.' Power +1 at any Hoth site. Permanent pilot provides ability of 1.
lore: \b Enclosed\b0  All Terrain Scout Transport (AT-ST). Provides flanking support to the AT-ATs of Blizzard Force. Modified for cold weather combat.
name: Blizzard Scout 1

gametext: May add 2 pilots and 8 passengers. Immune to attrition < 4. Landspeed may not be increased.
lore: \b Enclosed\b0  All Terrain Armored Transport. Commonly called an Imperial walker. One of the most terrifying and deadly weapons in the Empire's arsenal. 15.5 meters tall.
name: Blizzard Walker

gametext: If an Imperial just moved to an Echo site, deploy on your side of table. While you have presence at an Echo site, your total power is +1 in battles at Hoth sites.
lore: "Imperial troops have entered the base! Imperial troops have entered--"
name: Breached Defenses

gametext: Adds 2 to power of anything he pilots (3 if starship is \ul Tyrant\ul0). When on a Star Destroyer, may use its tractor beam once during each of your control phases.
lore: Captain of the Imperial Star Destroyer \ul Tyrant\ul0. An able \b leader\b0. Unlike most Imperial officers, he is dedicated to his ship and crew. Finds political maneuvering distasteful.
name: Captain Lennox

gametext: Power +1 when at same site as Vader. Adds 2 to power of anything he pilots (3 if starship is \ul Executor\ul0). May use 1 Force to take one Probe Droid into hand from Reserve Deck; reshuffle.
lore: Captain on the \ul Executor\ul0. Monitored probe droid telemetry. His flawless record of arrests and suppressions has contributed to an impressive rise through the ranks.
name: Captain Piett

gametext: Target a character at any marker site. Draw destiny. If site under "nighttime conditions," add 2 to destiny draw. If total destiny > ability, character may not move for remainder of turn.
lore: Wampas pack snow around the appendages of captured prey, making use of Hoth's cold environment to immobilize them.
name: Cold Feet

gametext: If you just moved an AT-AT to innermost marker, target one underground site on Hoth. Draw destiny. Target 'collapsed' if destiny > marker number.
lore: Most of Echo Base was tunneled out of a huge glacier by Rebel engineers. Its icy passageways could not withstand Imperial shelling.
name: Collapsing Corridor

gametext: If opponent just moved a character, vehicle or starship as a 'react' to a location, you may immediately move one vehicle or starship, if within range, to that location. (as a regular move)
lore: The Imperial Navy boasts the best communications network in the galaxy. Sophisticated control technology allows the Empire to dispatch armed forces without delay.
name: ComScan Detection

gametext: If you have a piloted AT-AT present at a site, target opponent's non-creature vehicle present at same or adjacent exterior site. Draw destiny. If that AT-AT has a vehicle weapon, add 1 to destiny draw. Target 'crashes' if total destiny > 3.
lore: AT-AT weapons are rarely quick enough to score a direct hit on a fast-moving snowspeeder. They are more likely to wing a craft, causing a forced landing.
name: Crash Landing

gametext: Use 3 Force to deploy on any exterior planet site. Target an opponent's smuggler. Each turn opponent must lose 1 Force at beginning of opponent's control phase. Utinni Effect canceled when reached by target (target goes to Used Pile).
lore: "A death mark's not an easy thing to live with. You're a good fighter, Solo. I hate to lose you."
name: Death Mark

gametext: Deploy on any system. Adds X to total power of your starships at that system, where X = number of your starships present. Your troopers and combat vehicles may shuttle to related sites for free.
lore: "Make ready to land our troops beyond their energy field and deploy the fleet so that nothing gets off the system."
name: Death Squadron

gametext: If an AT-AT, an AT-ST, Jabba's Sail Barge or Planet Defender Ion Cannon has just been lost at a site, draw destiny. All cards with that destiny number at that site are lost.
lore: A reactor core explosion in a destroyed AT-AT causes a plasma release which shatters its armor, showering the immediate area with molten projectiles.
name: Debris Zone

gametext: Use 3 Force to deploy on your Star Destroyer. Adds 2 to armor. If starship has immunity to attrition, also adds 2 to immunity.
lore: Located atop the superstructure of a Star Destroyer, the generator towers create an energy shield which repels solid objects and weapons fire.
name: Deflector Shield Generators

gametext: Add X to one weapon destiny (before weapon destiny is drawn) when targeting a combat vehicle. USED: X = 1. LOST: X = 3.
lore: Snowspeeders move much faster than AT-AT cannons can track, but if approaching on a poor attack vector, the snowspeeder is at the mercy of a well-trained AT-AT gunner.
name: Direct Hit

gametext: Deploy on any site. May be moved with two warriors for 1 additional Force. Your warrior present may target a starfighter (use 5 as defense value), character, creature or vehicle using 2 Force. Draw destiny. Target hit if destiny +1 > defense value.
lore: Massive infantry weapon powerful enough to damage even starfighters.
name: E-web Blaster

gametext: Use 2 Force to deploy on your AT-AT Cannon. It may fire at targets two sites away. Also, when used to Target The Main Generator, adds 1 to total.
lore: Long-range stereoscopic sighting device connected to the cannons of an Imperial walker. Calibrated to allow the AT-AT commander to accurately fire at distant targets.
name: Electro-Rangefinder

gametext: Opponent must lose 1 Force for each of opponent's missing characters on table. OR Select one missing character under "nighttime conditions" to be lost.
lore: "Sir, the temperature's dropping too rapidly." "That's right, and my friend's out in it."
name: Exhaustion

gametext: Use X Force during your control phase, where X = the total number of characters present or missing at exterior marker sites under "nighttime conditions." Those characters are lost.
lore: "Artoo says the chances of survival are 725 to 1."
name: Exposure

gametext: Once per turn, your 'hit' non-droid character at same or adjacent site may go to your Used Pile rather than your Lost Pile.
lore: Standard medical droid used by Imperial field units. Enhanced programming allows FX-10 to treat a wide variety of battle wounds.
name: FX-10 (Effex-ten)

gametext: Deploy on Hoth system. At the end of each player's turn, for every character that player has present at a marker site under "nighttime conditions," that player must lose 1 Force (2 if character is missing).
lore: "Luke! Luke! Don't do this, Luke. C'mon, gimme a sign here."
name: Frostbite

gametext: Deploy on opponent's character alone at Wampa Cave. Character is power = 0 and may not move. May be canceled if opponent has a lightsaber or total ability > 4 present. If character eaten by a creature, \b cumulatively\b0  adds 2 to ferocity.
lore: Freeze dried and ready to serve, a tasty, wholesome Rebel makes a nutritious meal for the whole wampa clan. They're Gr-r-reat!
name: Frozen Dinner

gametext: USED: Cancel Wookiee Roar, Han's Back or Life Debt. LOST: If Han and Chewie are in a battle together, draw two destiny. Subtract total from opponent's attrition and total power (cannot fall below zero).
lore: "All right, don't lose your temper". Hoth hath no fury like a Wookiee scorned.
name: Furry Fury

gametext: Power +1 when at same site as Admiral Ozzel. Adds 1 to power of each Imperial at same Hoth site. Adds 3 to power of any combat vehicle he pilots. On Blizzard 1, also adds 1 to armor and draws one battle destiny if not able to otherwise.
lore: General Maximillian Veers is the model of Imperial Army officer. Cunning, loyal and ruthlessly efficient \b leader\b0. In charge of the ground assault troops in Vader's forces.
name: General Veers

gametext: During your control phase, target any character alone at your exterior planet sites (except a docking bay). Draw destiny. Target is missing if destiny +3 > ability.
lore: "Princess Leia is wondering about Master Luke... She doesn't know where he is." "I don't know where he is." "Nobody knows where he is."
name: He Hasn't Come Back Yet

gametext: If an opponent's character with ability > 2 has just become missing, deploy on a Rebel with ability > 2 on same planet. Rebel may not participate in battle. Immediate Effect canceled if missing character is found or lost.
lore: When a Rebel is missing, ranking members of the Alliance express a professional yet dispassionate concern. Some are not so dispassionate.
name: High Anxiety

dark_side_text: If you control, for each of your starships here, your total power is +1 in battles at Hoth sites.
gametext: If you control, for each of your starships here, your total power is +1 in battles at Hoth sites.   If you control, for each of your starships here, your total power is +1 in battles at Hoth sites.
light_side_text: If you control, for each of your starships here, your total power is +1 in battles at Hoth sites.
name: Hoth

dark_side_text: Force drain +1 here. Add 1 to each of your weapon destiny draws here.
gametext: Your troopers are forfeit -1 here   Force drain +1 here. Add 1 to each of your weapon destiny draws here.
name: Hoth: Defensive Perimeter

dark_side_text: Add 1 to total of Commence Primary Ignition when targeting the Hoth system.
gametext: If you control, your starship movement from Hoth sites to the Hoth system is free.   Add 1 to total of Commence Primary Ignition when targeting the Hoth system.
light_side_text: If you control, your starship movement from Hoth sites to the Hoth system is free.
name: Hoth: Echo Command Center (War Room)

dark_side_text: If you occupy, you may raise all of your converted Hoth locations to the top.
gametext: If you occupy, you may raise all of your converted Hoth locations to the top.
name: Hoth: Echo Corridor

dark_side_text: Your docking bay transit from here requires 2 Force.
gametext: Your docking bay transit from here requires 1 Force.   Your docking bay transit from here requires 2 Force.
light_side_text: Your docking bay transit from here requires 1 Force.
name: Hoth: Echo Docking Bay

dark_side_text: During your move phase, you may move (for free) between here and Mountains.
gametext: If Main Power Generators on table, Force drain -1 here.   During your move phase, you may move (for free) between here and Mountains.
light_side_text: If Main Power Generators on table, Force drain -1 here.
name: Hoth: Ice Plains

dark_side_text: Your AT-ATs move to here for free.
gametext: Your AT-ATs move to here for free.
name: Hoth: North Ridge

gametext: If Main Power Generators on table, Force drain -1 here.   Your Wampas deploy free here.
light_side_text: If Main Power Generators on table, Force drain -1 here.
name: Hoth: Wampa Cave

gametext: Use 3 Force to place an opponent's just deployed character, starship, vehicle, weapon, or device in opponent's hand. On opponent's next turn, that card (or one card of same title) may deploy for free.
lore: "I can arrange that. You could USE a good kiss!"
name: I'd Just As Soon Kiss A Wookiee

gametext: Deploy at outermost marker. All characters present at same exterior site are missing. Each turn, during your control phase, storm moves to next marker, reversing direction if at innermost marker. Mobile Effect lost when moved beyond outermost marker.
lore: Among the gravest dangers in the harsh environment of Hoth are frequent, quick-moving ice storms.
name: Ice Storm

gametext: Use 4 Force to deploy at any site if opponent is generating at least 3 Force more than you. At that site, adjacent sites and same site as Vader, players activate Force only if they have presence.
lore: Vader's \b hologram\b0  exacts loyalty from his legions.
name: Image Of The Dark Lord

gametext: Deploy on any location. Whenever you control this location during your control phase but do not Force drain here, opponent generates no Force here on opponent's next turn.
lore: When Vader's forces impose the New Order upon a region, Rebel resources and lifelines are quickly eliminated.
name: Imperial Domination

gametext: Adds 1 to weapon destiny draws of anything he is aboard as a passenger.
lore: Walker operators work in pairs, one trained to pilot the AT-AT, the other serving as \b gunner\b0. Imperial gunners consider themselves the best marksmen in the Empire.
name: Imperial Gunner

gametext: USED: Lose 1 Force to activate 2 Force. LOST: Lose 1 Force to activate 4 Force.
lore: The Empire's efficient, fear-driven logistical systems can quickly divert weapons and equipment from one conflict to another, focusing on regions of highest strategic priority.
name: Imperial Supply

gametext: Deploy at same exterior site as your mining droid. 'Explodes' if a character deploys or moves (without using a vehicle or starfighter) to or across same site. Draw destiny. Character lost if destiny +2 > defense value. Infantry Mine is also lost.
lore: Deadly explosive typically planted on the perimeter of strategic sites or high-security installations to prevent Rebel spies and saboteurs from gaining access.
name: Infantry Mine

gametext: Adds 2 to power of anything he pilots. On \ul Tyrant\ul0, also adds 1 to armor. When in battle with an Imperial leader, subtracts 1 from opponent's total battle destiny.
lore: A recent graduate of the Officer's Candidate School on Carida. Serves as first officer of the \ul Tyrant\ul0. Ambitious, ruthless and efficient.
name: Lieutenant Cabbel

gametext: Cancel Lightsaber Proficiency. OR Target a character with ability < 4 using a lightsaber in a battle or a Force drain. Draw destiny. Target lost if destiny > ability. Lightsaber lost if destiny = ability.
name: Lightsaber Deficiency

gametext: Use 2 Force to deploy on an exterior planet site. Target a character on same planet. Character may not leave planet or move away from Utinni Effect. Utinni Effect canceled when reached by target.
lore: "There's a meteorite that hit the ground near here. I wanna check it out. Won't take long."
name: Meteor Impact?

gametext: Deploy on Chewie if Han was just lost or just became missing. Opponent cannot play Let The Wookiee Win or Wookiee Roar. Opponent must also lose 1 Force at end of every player's turn. If Han on table, Effect canceled.
lore: With the thought of losing Han, Chewbacca let out an anguished, sorrowful, lamenting, mournful, angst-ridden, tormented, agonizing roar.
name: Mournful Roar

gametext: Cancel an attempt by opponent to target your droid to be stolen, 'hit' or lost. Droid is protected from all such attempts for remainder of turn. OR Switch OFF any binary droid for remainder of turn.
lore: Mindless philosophy for an overweight glob of grease.
name: Oh, Switch Off

dark_side_text: Your Bounty Hunters are deploy -2 here.
gametext: Your Bounty Hunters are deploy -2 here.
name: Ord Mantell

gametext: Add 2 to a tractor beam destiny draw. OR Cancel The First Transport Is Away! or Hyper Escape.
lore: "Sir, Rebel ships are coming into our sector."
name: Our First Catch Of The Day

gametext: Deploy on your warrior. When that warrior fires a blaster rifle or artillery weapon, adds 1 to each of that weapon's destiny draws. Also, may add 1 to power of one droid present.
lore: Larger assault weapons require troops to carry their own power sources. Both light and efficient, these units produce ample power for most combat needs.
name: Portable Fusion Generator

gametext: Deploy on your Probe Droid. Adds 2 to X for that droid. OR Use 1 Force to deploy on one of your other droids. When at a site you control, once during each of your control phases, you may peek at one card randomly selected from opponent's hand.
lore: A probe droid encodes and scrambles messages before using its telescoping antennae to transmit information through hyperspace.
name: Probe Antennae

gametext: Deploys only if a Star Destroyer on table. Once during each of your control phases, may peek at X cards randomly selected from opponent's hand, where X = number of (Light Side Force icon) icons at same site. May Force drain, initiate battle and be battled.
lore: Arakyd Viper probe droid. Has sensors specifically designed to detect traces of Rebel activity. Equipped with an auto-destruct mechanism. A highly durable \b spy\b0  droid.
name: Probe Droid

gametext: Deploy on your probe droid. May target an artillery weapon (use 5 as defense value), character or creature for free. Draw destiny. Artillery weapon lost if destiny > defense value. Character or creature hit if destiny > defense value.
lore: Although a probe droid's primary defense is stealth, many models can be equipped with a laser cannon to enhance the droid's combat and sabotage capabilities.
name: Probe Droid Laser

gametext: Use 2 Force to choose X non-unique cards in any Lost Pile and place them out of play, where X = number of probe droids on table. OR If your only character on a planet is a probe droid, your cards deploy -1 to related sites for remainder of turn.
lore: Probe droids use electromagnetic, seismic, acoustic, olfactory and optical sensors. They report their findings using an omnisignal unicode.
name: Probe Telemetry

gametext: Use 2 Force to deploy on any war room at a Rebel Base. Target a Rebel with forfeit > 4 or an opponent's leader. Opponent may not initiate a battle or a Force drain at same location as target. Utinni Effect canceled when reached by target.
lore: "Headquarters personnel, report to command center."
name: Responsibility Of Command

gametext: USED: Cancel Solo Han, Warrior's Courage or I Know. LOST: If Han and Leia are in a battle together, draw two destiny. Subtract that amount from opponent's attrition and total power.
lore: "But you didn't see us alone in the south passage. She expressed her true feelings for me." "My... Why you stuck-up, half-witted, scruffy-looking NERF HERDER!"
name: Scruffy-Looking Nerf Herder

gametext: Lose a droid to cancel all attrition against you at same site this turn. OR Retarget an opponent's weapon to one of your droids at same site as target. If droid is 'hit', use original target's forfeit number.
lore: "'Fraid there's not much left... I didn't hit it that hard. It musta had a self-destruct."
name: Self-Destruct Mechanism

gametext: Use 2 Force to deploy on your side of table. Neither player may move or deploy cards as a 'react' to a location where a droid is present. May be canceled by Scomp Link Access.
lore: "Excuse me, sir, might I in--"
name: Silence Is Golden

gametext: Deploys only on Hoth. Power -1 when not at a Hoth site.
lore: Cold Assault troopers are specially trained and equipped to operate in frozen environments. Blizzard Force snowtroopers often work in tandem with AT-ATs.
name: Snowtrooper

gametext: Deploys only on Hoth. Snowtroopers deploy -1 to same site. Your troopers may move to same Hoth site as a 'react.'
lore: Elite snowtrooper officers, like all Imperial Army officers, are well versed in Rebel tactics. They serve as infantry liaisons to AT-ATs.
name: Snowtrooper Officer

gametext: May add 6 pilots, 8 passengers, 2 vehicles and 4 TIEs. Has ship-docking capability. Permanent pilot provides ability of 1. Probe droids deploy free to sites related to same system.
lore: Originally assigned to search the Outer Rim for new worlds to subjugate. Launched the probe droid that found Echo Base. Later reassigned to Death Squadron.
name: Stalker

gametext: Target one creature vehicle at any marker site. Draw destiny. Add 2 if site under "nighttime conditions." Tauntaun lost if total destiny > 5. Other creature vehicle lost if total destiny > 3.
lore: "Your tauntaun'll freeze before you reach the first marker."
name: Stop Motion

gametext: Lose 1 Force to take up to three troopers into hand from Reserve Deck; reshuffle.
lore: Highly organized Imperial infantry units can mobilize with incredible speed, often putting their surprised adversaries on the defensive.
name: Tactical Support

gametext: During your control phase, fire your AT-AT Cannon (if within range of the Main Power Generators) as follows: \par \b Prepare To Target The Main Generator\b0: Draw destiny. \par \b Maximum Firepower!\b0: If (destiny + X + Y) > 8, Main Power Generators site is "blown away" and this card is lost. Otherwise this card is used. \par X = ability of one of AT-AT's pilots. \par Y = total Hoth sites you control.
name: Target The Main Generator

gametext: If you have a probe droid at a site during your control phase, move one of your starships to the related system. That starship cannot move again this turn.
lore: "That is the system and I'm sure Skywalker is with them."
name: That's It, The Rebels Are There!

gametext: Deploy between Echo Docking Bay and innermost marker site. When under "nighttime conditions," no movement is allowed to or from Echo Docking Bay unless it is to or from an Echo site.
lore: "Your highness, there's nothing more we can do tonight. The shield doors must be closed."
name: The Shield Doors Must Be Closed

gametext: Deploy on any male character. Target a female character. Target is power -2. Utinni Effect canceled when present with target.
lore: "Why, I guess you don't know everything about women yet."
name: This Is Just Wrong

gametext: Use 2 Force to deploy on your side of table. Each non-creature vehicle at marker sites under "nighttime conditions" is power = 0, maneuver = 0 and landspeed = 0.
lore: "We're having some trouble adapting them to the cold."
name: Too Cold For Speeders

gametext: If you have a piloted AT-AT or AT-ST present at a site, target opponent's character, 'crashed' vehicle or unpiloted vehicle without armor present. Draw destiny. Character lost if destiny > ability. Vehicle lost if destiny < 7.
lore: The enormous feet of a walker are designed for mobility on many types of terrain. They also can be used by merciless pilots to crush the Rebellion.
name: Trample

gametext: USED: Cancel any attempt to place a 'hit' starship, vehicle or droid in the Used Pile rather than the Lost Pile. OR Cancel Han's Toolkit. LOST: Cancel Crash Site Memorial.
lore: "Turn it off! Turn it off! Off! TURN IT OFF!"
name: Turn It Off! Turn It Off!

gametext: May add 6 pilots, 8 passengers, 2 vehicles and 4 TIEs. Has ship-docking capability. Permanent pilot provides ability of 1. When using Tractor Beam, adds 1 to destiny draw.
lore: Assigned to Admiral Ozzel's Death Squadron. Attempted to capture Rebel starships fleeing the Hoth system.
name: Tyrant

gametext: Deploy at same exterior site as your mining droid. 'Explodes' if starfighter (use 5 as defense value) or non-creature vehicle deploys or moves to or across same site. Draw destiny. Target lost if destiny +2 > defense value. Vehicle Mine is also lost.
lore: Launches and detonates when activated by a passing metallic mass or the repulsorlift field of an approaching speeder. The shrapnel can hit even the quickest craft.
name: Vehicle Mine

gametext: If you have a piloted AT-AT present at a site, target opponent's artillery weapon at same or adjacent exterior site. Draw destiny. Target lost if destiny +1 > forfeit. Also, one opponent's character at same site as target (random selection) lost if destiny +1 > 6.
lore: Before an AT-AT's troops can disembark to engage the enemy, the walker must first destroy the Rebel traitors' defensive emplacements.
name: Walker Barrage

gametext: If you have a piloted AT-AT present at a site, target any number of opponent's troopers present at same or adjacent exterior site. Draw destiny. If destiny > number of troopers targeted, they are lost.
lore: Walkers are capable of incinerating entire infantry units in seconds. Rebel troops refer to the deadly barrage as the "wall of fire."
name: Wall Of Fire

gametext: * Ferocity = 3 + destiny. Habitat: Hoth sites. Deploy only to Wampa Cave or unoccupied marker site. Defeated characters are eaten or relocated to Wampa Cave (opponent of victim chooses).
lore: Sly, carnivorous beast which stalks the snow-packed tundra. Wampas frequently drag their prey to an ice cave for storage. They always prefer to devour their victims alive.
name: Wampa

gametext: Deploy on any docking bay. Target a weapon deployed on a starfighter or vehicle. That weapon cannot be fired. Utinni Effect canceled when reached by target.
lore: "Luke, we've got a malfunction in fire control. I'll have to cut in the auxiliary."
name: Weapon Malfunction

gametext: Target a creature vehicle at same site as a creature. If ferocity > target's maneuver + landspeed, creature vehicle is eaten, \b cumulatively\b0  adding 2 to creature's ferocity.
lore: "Steady. Hey! Steady, girl. Hey, what's the matter? You smell something?"
name: Yaggle Gakkle
